intro: Adromischus maximus, commonly known as the moonstone plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a bluish or purplish hue, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the growing season. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in bright, indirect light with well-draining soil. Its unique appearance and low maintenance make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
